abstract_summ: In this study, 30366 SARS-CoV-2 isolate genomes were aligned using the software developed by our group (ODOTool) and 11 variations in SARS-CoV-2 genome over 10% of whole isolates were discussed.Instead, recurrent SARS-CoV-2 mutations currently in circulation appear to be evolutionary neutral.METHODS: For this study, we analysed 2301 complete viral sequences reported from SARS-CoV-2 infected patients.Our results suggest that the pangolin coronavirus genome may have contributed to the SARS-CoV-2 genome by recombination with the bat coronavirus genome.As the SARS-CoV-2 genome sequences have become available, one of the important focus of scientists has become tracking variations in the viral genome.
title_summ: Population genomics insights into the recent evolution of SARS-CoV-2No evidence for increased transmissibility from recurrent mutations in SARS-CoV-2The origin and underlying driving forces of the SARS-CoV-2 outbreakMutation density changes in SARS-CoV-2 are related to the pandemic stage but to a lesser extent in the dominant strain with mutations in spike and RdRpThe origin and underlying driving forces of the SARS-CoV-2 outbreakAn updated analysis of variations in SARS-CoV-2 genomeGenomic diversity of SARS-CoV-2 in Coronavirus Disease 2019 patientsAnalysis of Rapidly Emerging Variants in Structured Regions of the SARS-CoV-2 GenomeDeveloping an ultra-efficient microsatellite discoverer to find structural differences between SARS-CoV-1 and Covid-19Evolving geographic diversity in SARS-CoV2 and in silico analysis of replicating enzyme 3CL(pro) targeting repurposed drug candidates
title_abstract_phrases: In this study, 30366 SARS-CoV-2 isolate genomes were aligned using the software developed by our group (ODOTool) and 11 variations in SARS-CoV-2 genome over 10% of whole isolates were discussed.Instead, recurrent SARS-CoV-2 mutations currently in circulation appear to be evolutionary neutral.METHODS: For this study, we analysed 2301 complete viral sequences reported from SARS-CoV-2 infected patients.Our results suggest that the pangolin coronavirus genome may have contributed to the SARS-CoV-2 genome by recombination with the bat coronavirus genome.As the SARS-CoV-2 genome sequences have become available, one of the important focus of scientists has become tracking variations in the viral genome.
